mobile app and website for donation

4CDONATIONS

mobile app responsive website ui/ux

My Role
Project Lead
UI/UX Design
UX Research

Team
Aubrey K. Young (Solo)

Project Duration
3 months

the situation

Schools are critically underfunded in the arts. Parents, individuals, and businesses need an easier process to support the nurturing of creativity in local schools.

the goal

Design both a mobile app and responsive website for users to donate art supplies and money, increasing support for children’s creative growth.

User Research

Research Summary

I conducted 4 interviews (3 by video call, 1 in person) in casual settings. The interviews were ~10 minutes each.

Goal: to understand common behaviors, experiences, and frustrations with users interested in donating to school art programs.

Participants: Participant ages ranged from mid-20s to mid-40s, and included elementary school parents and people pursuing creative fields. Further, participants were from various cultural/ethnic backgrounds who live and work in metropolitan or suburban areas.

research results

Through User Study interviews, I identified key pain points and opportunities for improvement.

1

users want a streamlined donation process

2

users want mobile app optimization to be prioritized, but appreciate the convenience of donating through a desktop browser

3

users want transparency into how their donations help fund their childrens' arts programs

personas

After analyzing the interview data, 2 personas emerged:

Low Fidelity Design

My Approach

Since the user priority was a multi-platform streamlined donation process, I used a modular approach to reduce visual clutter and to guide user actions.

User Journey

My two personas were from a user/donor perspective and from a teacher/receiver perspective. I used donor Franklin's User Journey to design the first iteration of the app.

Teacher Nina's journey is to execute a fundraiser through the website is listed as a future 4CDONATION development.

Sitemap

4CDONATION's sitemap is similar to other school donation sites like Boxtops for Education or Crayon Collection

Lo-fi Wireframes

My modular approach made it easier to lay out and design for responsive mobile, tablet, and desktop platforms.

The mobile app and responsive desktop differ in functionality. While the website is centered toward donations and general program information, the mobile app is centered around in-depth information on the schools, teachers, and projects that user donations will fund.

HOMEPAGES:

Lo-fi Usability Testing

The following findings emerged after of usability testing, which I used to create my hi-fi mockups.

1

"I wasn't sure what icon to press to get started."

Problem: users believe labeling the action buttons would allow more people to identify the app’s main functions.

Solution: Instead of relying on symbology, I added the button's function name for greater accessibility on the mobile app.

2

"I've messed up a pay amount using sliders before, so I'm extra careful when using one, especially on my phone."

Problem: a user believed the payment process could be more intuitive than using a slider to choose donation amount.

Solution: I changed the pay screen to buttons instead, which give the user more visual input and control over their donation amount.

High Fidelity Design

Colors & Fonts

4CDONATION's bold primary color scheme draws the user's eyes to specific modules for a streamlined experience.

#004483
#e84855
#f0fbff
#1b998b

Barlow is a geometric design providing a modern appearance and a sleek and straightforward aesthetic.

Future Iteration Ideas:

4CDONATION attempts to address the resource gap through community involvement with individuals, parents, and businesses. My aim is to create a user-centric platform that not only simplifies the donation process but also fosters a sense of community and transparency, ultimately increasing support for elementary school children’s creative growth.

Next step improvements:

1
User Education & Outreach

Create email newsletter and app notification communications to inform users about the changes and improvements being made to the platform

2
Creating a Fundraiser

will allow users to create fundraisers through their other social groups. This addition could greatly increase monetary and supply donations.

3
Teacher Dashboard

The teacher’s view of monetary donations or materials would include donation counters, the ability to add new projects, and allow group messages through email, text, or app notifcation to donors.
